context.p: User IDs and passwords of an organization can be created and maintained in the platform or in an existing LDAP system of the organization.

On the Manage LDAP settings page, you can define and manage LDAP settings that apply to the whole platform. You can also check and restore the settings for an organization's LDAP system, for example when the LDAP system cannot be reached.

Defining platform LDAP settings is useful if LDAP settings are to be reused for several organizations on your platform. It is possible to overwrite, omit, or add additional settings in the LDAP settings of each organization.

step.cmd: To save your entries, click Save.

result.p: To check and update an organization's LDAP settings:

ol.li:
Select the organization for which you want to define or update the LDAP connection.
The currently defined LDAP settings and their values are listed. You can also see whether a setting corresponds to a platform default setting.
Click Export to save the current settings to a file on your file system.
Edit the configuration file as required.
To load the organization's LDAP settings, click the File name entry field or Browse, and select the file containing the updated settings.

Click Import and confirm the message.
Be aware that this action replaces all existing LDAP settings for the organization.
To check if the connection to the LDAP system can be established, click Test connection.
